body:
Aye fellas,
im looking for a good pc build all under 600$ or less.  I've been playing on an old Apple desktop and it can barely run small online games. For this build, a ll I want to do is minecraft and use it for day to day life. I don't know much about any computor stuff so I was hoping some of you lads could help me out in the making.

thanks

title: PC build

replies.body:
/summon Loo

/summon Sevo

These 2 folks will probably help the most. All I can say is buy the parts from Ebay. It is super cheap and shipping is often free. I got a 180GB hard drive for 10 bucks from there and a Corsair Bronze 430W for 35 bucks.

replies.body:
Some questions:

-Budget?

-Country?

-What exactly are you going to be doing?

-How long will you be using this PC?

-Any specific colors you like?

-Do you record videos or edit videos? 

-Anything you need? (mouse, keyboard, etc)

-Anything else you need?

My Skype is SevoMC. I'll get to you next morning the latest. Answer these and I'll get you a build tomorrow ;).

replies.body:
https://ca.pcpartpicker.com/user/SevoPC/saved/NYRfrH

This will easily get over 60 FPS in Minecraft. It actually has the same CPU and GPU I have. I would recommend bumping your budget up to 700-750$ if you want a better build overall but if all you want is good performance this will do fine. Also, you are going to have to get a Windows CD key, unless you want to buy the legit version of windows. Other than that, the keyboard is a very reliable one. I used to use it and I liked it a lot for the money.

Have fun with your build!

replies.body:
http://ca.pcpartpicker.com/list/CCX8KZ

Easily runs games like Minecraft and CS:GO at mostly max settings and other demanding games at medium/low settings. It has an SSD so it will boot up in about 15 seconds and the HDD will have plenty of space for a lot of games and programs. I added a wireless adapter and an optical drive but it's up to you if you need them, you can take them off to make the build even cheaper.

Like Sevo said, you're going to need to get a Windows key somehow other than buying it because it's very expensive. I have a Windows 10 key but I don't know if it still works so don't count on that too much.
